if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."},"UpdatedZetaConnectorTSSAddress(address,address)":{"params":{"newTSSAddress":"new tss address","oldTSSAddress":"old tss address"}},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."},"Withdrawn(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens withdrawn.","to":"The address to which the tokens are withdrawn."}},"WithdrawnAndCalled(address,uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens withdrawn.","data":"The calldata passed to the contract call.","to":"The address to which the tokens are withdrawn."}},"WithdrawnAndReverted(address,uint256,bytes,(address,address,uint256,bytes))":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens withdrawn.","data":"The calldata passed to the contract call.","revertContext":"Revert context to pass to onRevert.","to":"The address to which the tokens are withdrawn."}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address)":{"details":"Set admin as default admin and pauser, and tssAddress as tss role."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"receiveTokens(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens received."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"updateTSSAddress(address)":{"params":{"newTSSAddress":"new tss address"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Set admin as default admin and pauser, and tssAddress as tss role.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw.
params.internalSendHash: A hash used for internal tracking of the transaction.
params.to: The address to withdraw tokens to.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw.
params.data: The calldata to pass to the contract call.
params.internalSendHash: A hash used for internal tracking of the transaction.
params.to: The address to withdraw tokens to.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw.
params.data: The calldata to pass to the contract call.
params.internalSendHash: A hash used for internal tracking of the transaction.
params.revertContext: Revert context to pass to onRevert.
params.to: The address to withdraw tokens to.

PAUSER_ROLE().notice: New role identifier for pauser role.

TSS_ROLE().notice: New role identifier for tss role.

WITHDRAWER_ROLE().notice: New role identifier for withdrawer role.

gateway().notice: The Gateway contract used for executing cross-chain calls.

tssAddress().notice: The address of the TSS (Threshold Signature Scheme) contract.

withdraw(address,uint256,bytes32).notice: Withdraw tokens to a specified address.

withdrawAndCall((address),address,uint25.notice: Withdraw tokens and call a contract through Gateway.

withdrawAndRevert(address,uint256,bytes,.notice: Withdraw tokens and call a contract with a revert callback through Gateway.

zetaToken().notice: The address of the Zeta token.
